meanings.definition: A thing that can be seen and touched.
meanings.sent1: The shiny object caught my eye.
meanings.sent2: She placed the object on the table.
meanings.sent3: The object seemed to wink at me from the shelf.
meanings.sent4: His smile was an object of pure joy.
meanings.sent5: The object felt cold and smooth in my hand.

meanings.sent1: Her main object is to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent2: The object of the game is to score the most points.
meanings.sent3: His object is to make everyone laugh with his jokes.
meanings.sent4: The object of life is to find happiness.
meanings.sent5: The object of the meeting is to discuss the new proposal.

meanings.sent1: I object to the new rule at school.
meanings.sent2: She objects to the idea of moving to a new city.
meanings.sent3: He always objects when it's time to clean his room.
meanings.sent4: The crowd began to object loudly to the decision.
meanings.sent5: I object to the way he treats his employees.
